meanings.definition: (Latin) I go back, I retreat, I withdraw
meanings.english_definition: (Latin) First-person singular present indicative of retrocedere: I go back, I retreat, I withdraw

verb_forms.present_indicative: retrocedo, retrocedis, retrocedit, retrocedimus, retroceditis, retrocedunt
verb_forms.imperfect_indicative: retrocedebam, retrocedebas, retrocedebat, retrocedebamus, retrocedebatis, retrocedebant
verb_forms.future_indicative: retrocedam, retrocedes, retrocedet, retrocedemus, retrocedetis, retrocedent
verb_forms.perfect_indicative: retrocessi, retrocessisti, retrocessit, retrocessimus, retrocessistis, retrocesserunt
verb_forms.pluperfect_indicative: retrocesseram, retrocesseras, retrocesserat, retrocesseramus, retrocesseratis, retrocesserant
verb_forms.future_perfect_indicative: retrocessero, retrocesseris, retrocesserit, retrocesserimus, retrocesseritis, retrocesserint

usage_notes.explanation: Retrocedo is the first-person singular present active indicative form of the Latin verb retrocedere. It is used to describe the action of going back, retreating, or withdrawing, performed by the speaker.

level_frequency.frequency_comment: Relatively infrequent outside of Latin texts.

readability_explanation.text: This is a Latin verb form. Understanding requires knowledge of Latin grammar and vocabulary.
